If you do not need to redraw your view during each frame update cycle, or if you are willing to accept an approximation of the view’s intermediate appearance during potentially brief animations in exchange for an animation performance and smoothness benefit, you can change the value of this property to one of the modes that does not require constant redrawing. When you do so, you must also specify the desired layer content placement for the view. Resize the view’s backing-layer and redraw the view to the layer when the view’s size changes. If the resize is animated, AppKit will drive the resize animation itself and will do this resize and redraw at each step of the animation. Affected parts of the layer will also be redrawn when the view is marked as needing display. This mode is a superset of

Leave the layer’s contents alone. Never mark the layer as needing display, or draw the view’s contents to the layer. This is how developer created layers (layer-hosting views) are treated.
